tweets.text: Our bunds trial has shown promising preliminary results. The bunds are holding up to 300mm water in the environment, for at least 12 hours. This will slow the flow of water from the hills and rewet the moor, so it‚Äôs boggier and better for biodiversity. https://t.co/w5YLw8OQ8n https://t.co/CZ8Vk9VBg9

The evidence is clear @GawRagbag. This is what's happened to my friends and visitors in just 50 years. Lot's of human talk, very little human action. As a river I am sick of it. @EnvAgency @NatResWales @CommonsEAC @WGEnviroAgri @Feargal_Sharkey @theriverstrust @AfonyddCymru https://t.co/xu0QNDg0oQ https://t.co/N2Oqy9Drkj

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/ZaGaaolbzu

We're working with @EnvAgency to deliver #NFM flood management techniques, slowing the flow of water from the hills to reduce flooding, across catchments in @EnvAgencyNW - including the construction of 200 mini-dams in Stalybridge #FloodActionWeek 

https://t.co/sNySGMrwcM https://t.co/NKOe0XYNGp

tweets.text:
It's #FloodActionWeek and also 10yrs since the Nov 2010 floods that affected 300+ properties in Cornwall. Following the floods The EA & @CornwallCouncil created @CwllCFloodForum to help before, during & after a flood. 
Do you know what to do in a flood? https://t.co/4F9BadnblZ https://t.co/oZe6Kg8BsR
@MarkBowersEA @EnvAgencyMids Also true in Hereford

@Young_Nudger I give up trying to have a sensible discussion, seems it‚Äôs falling on deaf ears. 

It‚Äôs really hard seeing you post #fakenews which does nothing but undermine the hard work of us, IDB‚Äôs & Doncaster, Barnsley, Rotherham, Sheffield LLFA‚Äôs.

@GeoscienceEA @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgencySW @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgencyNW Superb visuals - I ask this roughly once a year: when are we going to see this data in a 3D context inside the BGS national bedrock model (delivered to the @GeoscienceEA ca 5 years ago üòÅ) #innovation

tweets.text: This week is @EnvAgencySE Flood Action week. Last year we saw flooding across our communities from #Aylesford to #EastPeckham, #Hadlow, #Tonbridge and #Hildenborough. This useful graphic reminds us of what we need to prepare to do. https://t.co/QiquWC4gHu

A week of striking stats... There are 152 @EnvAgencyNW  #flood warning areas in #Lancashire. 75 of these have under 50% sign up from those able to receive them! Pls do sign up  https://t.co/3Z355LqJ1W & spread the word #PrepareActSurvive #FloodActionWeek https://t.co/jihX3Rv4Ij

Would you know what to do in a flood? Knowing what to do could save your life. For more information visit https://t.co/29saU1M83o.   #PrepareActSurvive #FloodActionWeek üöóüåä https://t.co/DN10Utzl99

tweets.text: Great to see survey work starting on the latest phase of the Rotherham Renaissance Flood Alleviation Scheme. This ¬£20 million project extends along a 5km stretch of the River Don through #Templeborough, the town centre and #Parkgate areas of #Rotherham. https://t.co/NCyt8atUoA https://t.co/35dvw3ld08

Yesterday we attended an incident involving suspected large scale dumping and burning of commercial waste on #Agricultural land. Thanks to @DerbyshireFRS for the call and their efforts in dealing with the fire. 3 arrested and a joint investigation is now underway with @EnvAgency https://t.co/Sk35jPMDKL

Some great drone footage and imagery of the NFM interventions and wider Isbourne catchment. Thanks to the guys @worcester_uni. Click link to see pano. @josieellalynch @Worldwidevillan @worcscc @EnvAgencyMids @isbournecatch #nfm #nfmbydrone #slowtheflow https://t.co/BiDQWhYaFP https://t.co/90nnMB2AxC

Sangeetha, one of our brilliant #geomorphologists in @EnvAgencyMids, helped with the design of this #river restoration scheme in #StokeOnTrent.

An example of what's possible in urban settings, even during trying times like these, when working in partnership. https://t.co/2xDxuiFitR

tweets.text: @lilrobbergirl @l_marazzi @EnvAgency Sadly reducing resources for these important statutory organisations also undermines the ability of local groups to do good things. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs an either-or; we need Govt and society to work together

@fluitans @lilrobbergirl @EnvAgency Agreed 100%. Lots of competent professionals out here can do so much more. Let's find ways & resources to join forces @FreshwaterIzzy @carlsayerUCL @emma_wiik @lucyrroberts @theriverstrust @SE_Rivers_Trust @Thames21 @Earthwatch_Eur @SWS_org

It's #FloodActionWeek & we're running a FREE training webinar on the roles of a Flood Warden & #flood risk awareness as part of @wiltscouncil's Winter Preparedness Event. We'll be delivering this with #Wiltshire Council & @EnvAgencySW on the 24th Nov. 
‚û°Ô∏èhttps://t.co/9rXuWMP7Eu https://t.co/DSqz5TfDv0
@l_marazzi @fluitans @EnvAgency Local groups are rising up everywhere, fundraising & doing their own surveys & investigation on loved local places under threat, so maybe yes

We're planning a virtual public event for the Naburn community to let them know more about Property Flood Resilience (PFR) to help reduce their flood risk. 

You can help us by taking part in a survey to make the event useful https://t.co/OgHd2hDHei

#prepareactsurvive #York https://t.co/2JUiRpSyum

Mark Fuller was on duty during the biggest flood of the River Ouse that York has ever seen - he looks back on  November 2000 in this blog https://t.co/7GDdByfbxr

Taking action before a flood could keep the things you care about safe #prepareactsurvive #York https://t.co/AL8NTcjqdD

Part of the Trans Pennine Trail re-opened after an upgrade to flood defences at Hull's Victoria Dock Village https://t.co/bwwgv2mKS0

These improvements are part of the ¬£42m tidal scheme.

Be prepared, have a flood plan  
#PrepareActSurvive #Floodaware https://t.co/wwueotBnkz https://t.co/ay7oz07E8K
